alert.note: Alert for Canadian; Cleveland; Grady; Oklahoma (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 03 at 8:10PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central Oklahoma, including the following counties, Canadian, Cleveland, Grady and Oklahoma. * WHEN...Until 930 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 810 PM CDT, Rain has ended over the advisory area, but some flooding may still be occurring in low-lying and flood prone areas where heavy rain of between 1 and 2 inches of rain fell late this afternoon and early this evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southern Oklahoma City, Norman, Moore, Midwest City, Del City, Newcastle, Mustang, Choctaw, Tuttle, Valley Brook, Tinker Air Force Base. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
